title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: greater anglia apologise over norwich-cambridge disruption .
police seek cctv after woman raped .
take over bandstand in lord mayor 's celebration .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: another week has come to an end of our local live service for the county .
today 's highlights have included :
scroll down to read more on these and join us again when our regular updates return at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with possibility of sharp showers
text: cloud will develop from the north west bringing a small chance of isolated sharp showers across the bbc east region tonight .
but it will remain dry for many areas with clear spells later .
light rain or drizzle is possible across western counties later as the temperature falls to 12c ( 54f ) in places .
saturday will be another dry day with sunny spells and some cloud and it will be cooler on the coast .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 76f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: rail line reopens after lightning strike
text: greater anglia is reporting that the norwich-cambridge line is now open again .
it had been closed following a lightning strikes on overhead cables between attleborough and thetford in norfolk and between shippea hill and ely in cambridgeshire .
however , delays are expected as services get back to normal .
17:18 - # attleborough ( lines are now open ) & some other updates to note here good service other routes .
rs

documents.title: howson and christie join middlesbrough
text: howson and christie join middlesbrough

documents.title: norfolk mps ' bid for committee chairmanships
text: two of norfolk 's mps want to lead influential parliamentary committees .

richard bacon , the mp for south norfolk , has put himself forward to chair the house of commons treasury committee , while norman lamb ( north norfolk ) wants to lead the science and technology committee .
elections for the posts will be held among mps next week .
select committees have become a very influential part of parliamentary work .
they investigate topcs of concern and they have the power to call anyone as a witness .
their reports often influence and sometimes change government policy .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: police patrol norwich a week after a rape in a bid to find witnesses
text: police checks will be carried out tomorrow night one week after a woman was raped in a suburb of norwich .
officers will be patrolling yarmouth road in thorpe st andrew in a bid to trace any potential witnesses to the attack which happened last saturday between 21:45 and and 22:00 .
det insp neil stewart hoped the checks would trigger the memories of potential witnesses .
`` yarmouth road is one of the main routes into norwich and there are several places to eat and drink , '' he said .

`` i 'm hopeful we will capture people who visit the area regularly who may have seen something last saturday night which initially does n't seem important , but , on reflection , could be relevant to our inquiry . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: from the archives : kett 's rebellion - norwich 1549
text: some 586 years ago this month , british tanner robert kett led a rebellion .
this shows him and his followers in what was known as kett 's rebellion on mousehold heath , which overlooked the city of norwich .
the protest against the enclosure of land , when common land became private property , began at wymondham on 8 july 1549 .
the rebels were defeated by an army in august .

documents.title: new norfolk firefighters at passing out parade
text: the hard work of norfolk 's newest full-time firefighters has been celebrated at a passing out parade .
senior norfolk fire & rescue service staff , friends and families of the new recruits gathered at the training centre in bowthorpe today .
over the last 12 weeks , they have been through a rigorous practical and written training plan to learn the key skills of the job .
their training will now continue as they join their watches in carrow ( norwich ) , great yarmouth and king 's lynn , where they will be in development for the next couple of years .
as well as learning how to use the equipment and breathing apparatus as part of their course , they have taken part in activities including :
margaret dewsbury , chairman of norfolk county council 's communities committee , said : `` it 's great to see these people starting their career ladders to this new and exciting job .
`` their work in keeping the communities of norfolk safe is so worthwhile and valuable to all of us and i wish them well in their new roles . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: portrait wins norfolk-wide vith forms art competition
text: the winner of the first norfolk sixth forms and colleges art competition has been announced .

lexie cox ( below ) , of reepham high school and college , took the prize with a portrait ( acrylic on board , above ) , with amy nash ( dereham sixth form college ) taking the runners-up prize with a digital drawing .

a-level art students from 15 sixth forms and colleges across the county took part in the competition and their works are on display to the public at duke street gallery , norwich university of the arts ( nua ) .
county council adviser for 14-19 development robert rickard , who co-ordinated the event , said :
`` the standard of work was remarkable - it 's clear we have some real talent across the county . ''
norfolk sixth forms and colleges art exhibition is run by heads of art and ncc , in partnership with royal norfolk show and nua .

documents.title: from the archives : building norwich city 's ground in 1935
text: some 82 years ago this month , the construction of norwich city football club 's new ground at carrow road was under way .

documents.title: breakingmiddlesbrough confirm jonny howson deal
text: jonny howson 's transfer from norwich city to middlesbrough has moved a step closer .
boro have confirmed they agreed a deal with the canaries this morning and the midfielder is due to have a medical later .
howson was city 's player of the year in 2015/16 and it 's believed the yorkshireman and former leeds youngster wants to move closer to home .
jonny howson set to become @ twitterid first summer signing after # boro agree a deal with @ twitterid

author: Chris Goreham

documents.title: harford manor school closed due to flooding
text: harford manor school in norwich is closed today after major flooding caused by the storms yesterday afternoon .
five classrooms , the hall and the toilets were all affected during the downpour which also resulted in an electrical fault .
it happened after the children had gone home .
staff hope to reopen on monday morning .

documents.title: loss of rail services between norwich and cambridge 'frustrating '
text: we 've been following the major disruption to train services between norwich and cambridge following a storm yesterday .
network rail is trying to repair it but at the moment services via thetford , brandon and ely have been suspended .
lucy wright , of greater anglia railways , told the bbc : `` lightning struck in the attleborough area which means we ca n't run services at all on the norwich to cambridge line .
`` it is very frustrating and out of our control .
we do apologise to passengers . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: introducing take over bandstand in lord mayor 's celebration
text: introducing in norfolk is taking over the bandstand in chapelfield gardens tomorrow , with performances from some of the best new bands in the county , as part of the lord mayor 's celebration .
from 15:00 to 22:00 , 10 local acts will be playing the bandstand stage .

the bands include yourth killed it ( above ) , tuesday club , jack breeze-lamb and heylate , the naked lights , gentleman , waves , visitors , history and lore ( below ) , the renadeans and moonlands .
introducing presenter sophie little ( below with waves ' vikki ) said she is looking forward to saturday 's performances .
`` it 's one of the highlights of our calendar , '' she said .
`` it 's a really buzzy day , and a brilliant opportunity to catch the best of the exciting talent coming out of our county , ''
introducing in norfolk is on bbc radio norfolk at 19:00 on saturdays , and available on the bbc iplayer .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: greater anglia apologise over norwich-cambridge disruption
text: greater anglia have issued a statement on the disruption to the norwich-cambridge rail line :
`` train services are currently suspended between norwich and ely , owing to damaged signalling equipment caused by an electrical storm lightning strike on thursday , 6 july .
`` network rail is working with its suppliers to rectify the fault , however , there will be no services between norwich and ely until further notice and customers are advised not to travel .
`` we apologise to passengers for the severe disruption and inconvenience caused .
`` customers travelling between norwich and cambridge can travel via stowmarket .
tickets dated 7 , july 2017 will be valid for use on saturday , 8 july 2017 between norwich and cambridge .
`` customers who have been affected by the disruption can claim compensation at this website . ''

documents.title: lord mayor 's celebration celebrates norwich
text: this year 's lord mayor 's celebration in norwich starts today and runs for three days .
this year 's theme welcome to norwich celebrates the fine city 's tradition of welcoming people from across the world to enjoy all it has to offer .

as well as annual highlights such as the lord mayor 's procession and gas hill gasp ( a run up gas hill ) , there will also everything from water balloon tossing outside city hall to a pirate party on westlegate .

as part of an array of street performers , the bbc radio norfolk introducing stage ( more on this later ) will have bands such as waves and tuesday club , while the maui waui lion 's den stage will be home to folk , reggae and everything in between .
this year will also see the norwich arts centre take over the stage outside the forum , providing a fantastic mix of music and performance , including one by bbc 6 music favourites sink ya teeth .
city hall will play host to cirque bordello 's lost in translation circus , as clowns and acrobats take over the building .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: thompson suffers second achilles injury
text: thompson suffers second achilles injury

documents.title: lightning strike delays norwich-cambridge trains
text: trains between norwich and cambridge have been cancelled until further notice because of a lightning strike .
commuters faced long delays yesterday as services between norwich and diss , london , cambridge and ipswich were cancelled or delayed following thunder storms .
the fire service was called out to deal with flash flooding incidents across norfolk .
harford manor school in norwich is closed this morning after the school has flooded following an electrical fault .
stations affected include ely , lakenheath , brandon , thetford , attleborough and wymondham .
for the latest , visit the greater anglia website , or follow them on twitter .
# attleborough - during the storm yesterday , lightning damaged the signalling between thetford & attleborough & between shippea hill & ely

also the red flag man law in front of cars has now been dropped .

you jest
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: police seek cctv after woman raped in thorpe st andrew
text: detectives investigating a rape in norwich are going door-to-door asking for cctv footage from residents .
a 30-year-old woman was grabbed and raped as she walked home along yarmouth road in thorpe st andrew , near norwich .
officers are also appealing for dash cam recordings of anyone travelling in the area at about 22:00 on saturday .

documents.title: weather : dry and very warm but cloudy later
text: bright or sunny spells will dominate and it will become very warm in a light breeze although cloud cover will increase in places .
some rain showers are expected during a very muggy night .
maximum temperature : 27c ( 81f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: norwich city midfielder could miss entire season
text: norwich city 's louis thompson has suffered a second achilles injury which will rule him out for at least the next six months .
the midfielder was trying to battle back from a similar injury which he up in january which ended his season .
he has had a second operation and the club 's sporting director stuart webber said : `` it is expected louis will be unavailable for a substantial period , if not the entirety , of this season . ''
the 22-year-old has n't been able to play since november and has made just three league appearances for norwich city since arriving from swindon town in the summer of 2014 .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: hello and welcome to another day of rolling news from across norfolk .
we 'll be here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather as we get it .
do n't forget - you can get in touch too - just click on the get involved button at the top of the feed .
stay here for a full weather forecast in a moment .
hope you escaped the worst of the thunder and flash floods yesterday .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage for the day
text: that 's it for our live news feeds for today - thanks for your company .
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow .
have a quick scroll down through the feed to see what 's been going on across the county today .
and do n't forget you can get in touch using the get involved icon at the top of the screen .
we 'll leave you with this lovely shot of sheringham from our busy weather watcher hopping frog .
have a nice evening .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : pne boss neil will spend 'wisely '
text: new preston north end manager alex neil says money to improve the current squad will be spent `` wisely '' .
the 36-year-old former norwich and hamilton boss spoke to the media yesterday after being confirmed as simon grayson 's replacement .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: warning of blocked train lines between attleborough and ely

engineers at greater anglia are working to fix signals that have been damaged by lightning at attleborough :
due to lightning damaging the signalling system between # attleborough and ely all lines are blocked .
disruption is expected until 21:00 .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'mystery creature ' seen crossing street
text: 'mystery creature ' seen crossing street

documents.title: appeal fails in bid to build 200 homes in north norfolk
text: a plan to build 200 homes in sculthorpe has been turned down - despite an appeal by developers .
fears had been raised that the site would have doubled the size of the village , as well as traffic volume .
north norfolk district council ( nndc ) originally rejected the plans in january 2016 .
amstel group corporation tried to have the decision overturned .
the planning inspector confirmed that the council already has a five-year supply of deliverable housing sites in the district .

cllr tom fitzpatrick , leader of nndc and local member for sculthorpe , said : `` the inspector 's findings show the importance of planned and sustainable development that does n't swamp existing communities but conserves and builds on what is already there .
`` this plan was never sustainable - the village has no shop , one restaurant and an infrequent bus service .
`` the development would have doubled the size of the village and potentially at least doubled the traffic movements because of the nature of the family homes proposed .
`` we are not averse to development , but it must be in the right place . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: can you identify swaffham 's late-night visitor ?
text: an unusual four-legged creature has been spotted taking a stroll through market place in swaffham in the wee small hours .
but what on earth is it ?

documents.title: chedgrave road collision : one person has died
text: a motorist has died in a rush hour road traffic collision in chedgrave near loddon .
it happened at around 07:45 this morning on the a146 near the junction with norwich road .
police say a woman was also taken to the norfolk and norwich hospital with a pelvic injury .
the roads have been closed in the area and diversions remain in place .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man dies in west norfolk garage accident
text: a man has died in a garage while working on a vehicle , norfolk police have confirmed .
police were called to a d hurst in baptist road , upwell at around 08:30 on tuesday , following reports a man had been injured as he carried out mechanical work on a vehicle .
the man , in his 40s , was pronounced dead at the scene .
norfolk police and the health and safety executive are investigating .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich airport masterplan : you can have your say
text: so what 's the vision for norwich airport ?
passenger numbers : the airport wants to almost double the numbers who use it to 930,000 by 2030 - and treble them to 1.4m by 2045 .
attract business : there are plans for a 100-acre imperial park on land accessed by the northern distributor road .
runway and taxiways : the masterplan includes an 500m extension to the runway and more taxiways to allow bigger aircraft to land .
it also wants to move the control tower closer to the terminal .
local economy and jobs : around 1,240 jobs are directly supported by the airport .
by 2030 , that could rise to 1,950 .
the airport 's contribution to the local economy could rise from £ 70m to £ 120m by 2030 .
more destinations : plans to target dublin and paris to complement the existing amsterdam route .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: championship fixtures in full
text: championship fixtures in full

documents.title: godwits leave welney reserve
text: twenty-six endangered godwit chicks , hand-reared at the wildfowl and wetlands trust in welney , are now flying away from the site .
the black-tailed birds were carefully raised at the fenland nature reserve in an attempt to boost their population .
each chick has a coloured leg ring , and conservationists now want people to help track them as they fly away .
here was the moment they were initially released a few weeks ago
louise clewley , a warden at the reserve , said the last couple of weeks had been `` nail-biting '' .
`` you just do n't know what 's going to happen when you open those doors , '' she told bbc radio cambridgeshire .
`` you think 'are they going to do something silly ? '
`` but so far they 've flown off and have been feeding with adult godwits . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'masterplan ' vision for norwich airport
text: norwich airport has published a draft masterplan - setting out a vision for the airport 's growth over the next 30 years .
the aim is to boost the region 's connectivity - and potentially treble passenger numbers .
and you can have a say - as it 's open to consultation until 17 august .
passenger numbers exceeded 500,000 for the first time last year since 2008 , and could rise to 1.4m by 2045 .
the airport is worth some £ 70m to the local economy - and this could increase to £ 170m in the same period .
it employs 250 people .

richard pace , managing director of norwich airport , said : `` the masterplan sets out the vision for the future development of norwich airport and its continued vital role in supporting our region 's economy .

`` the aim is to continue to be the transport hub for the offshore oil , gas and renewable industries for the southern north sea , and a centre of excellence for the maintenance , repair and overhaul of aircraft , closely linked to the international aviation academy norwich in which we are a founding partner .
`` by continuing to engage with the community we look forward to the airport further enhancing the connectivity and the social and economic fortunes of our region . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: underwater mural brightens cromer 's west prom
text: how 's this for artwork ?
the shipwreck play area on cromer 's new west prom has been transformed into a glorious underwater scene - with a lick of paint .
the 26-metre mural de the wildlife local to north norfolk 's coast , including seals , fish and seaweed .
north norfolk district council worked with local artist mark harper to create the mural .
he said : `` i enjoyed the challenge of this large mural and the fun i could have with the feel of it enclosing the shipwreck .
`` i think it really works and i hope people walking along the prom or climbing on the shipwreck enjoy it . ''
the mural is part of the council 's £ 1m cromer west prom investment which has 'future-proofed ' the promenade .
the entire block can be craned to higher ground in the event of a storm surge .

cllr maggie prior cabinet member for leisure said : `` to be climbing on a shipwreck , and be surrounded by images of sea creatures and plants just increases the fun and we hope it inspires imaginations .
`` the new facilities and refurbishment of west prom are a superb addition to cromer and are part of a programme of investments in cromer to enhance jobs and boost the tourism economy . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: children 's services 'improving ' in norfolk
text: a new report says that norfolk 's children 's services department is improving .
the county council department has been ranked as 'inadequate ' by inspectors since 2013 .
but now ofsted says it is making 'steady progress ' - although it still has a long way to go .
penny carpenter , the conservative county councillor responsible for childrens services , said : `` we have got some areas that are weak where we have to do a lot of underpinning .
`` there is a long way to go and it 's not an overnight thing .
`` like any organisation it does take a while for it to be embedded and move on . ''

documents.title: norwich prison attack 'symptom of system in crisis '
text: there are calls for the ministry of justice to be more transparent about assaults against prison staff - after details of an attack in norwich were leaked .
a prison guard was attacked by an inmate on 11 june - he suffered wounds to his jaw , neck and hands and required hospital treatment .
details of the assault were passed to bbc radio norfolk by a man claiming to be an inmate at hmp norwich .
his account has been verified by the prison officers ' association and the ambulance service .
rob preece from the howard league for penal reform says such attacks are a symptom of a system in crisis :
take norwich prison for example .
it 's designed to hold 626 men safely and decently - it 's currently being asked to hold 743 .
we 've got chronic overcrowding in prisons including norwich .
we 've seen the number of staff on the wings come down and we 've seen a real decline in purposeful activity .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic diversions in chedgrave after rush hour accident
text: the emergency services are currently at the scene of a serious road traffic collision at chedgrave .
officers were called shortly after 07:45 to reports of a collision involving two vehicles on the a146 .
the road has been closed and diversions are in place .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: elderly man dies in road crash
text: an elderly man has died in a road traffic collision in north walsham .
the man - in his 80s - was in a green mazda tribute car that left the a149 cromer road shortly before 15:15 yesterday .
he died at the scene .
the road was reopened around 19.10 .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wanted man found in birmingham
text: a wanted man has been found by police .
officers in norfolk appealed for help in finding harry goodrum , 20 , in connection with offences including assault , theft and criminal damage .
it follows a number of incidents between march and june this year .
he 's been detained in birmingham .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : warm day with thunderstorms possible
text: a warm start to the day , with sunny spells after any early fog .
increasing risk of thunderstorms mainly later in the day , with local intense downpours and possible hail , bringing the risk of sudden flooding .
feeling very warm and humid by the afternoon , with highs of 26c ( 79f ) .
get the latest on the weather where you live on the bbc weather website .

BBC Weather

text: hello and welcome to another day of rolling news from across norfolk .
we 'll be here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather as we get it .

documents.title: that 's all from local live this wednesday
text: that 's it from local live for today - although we will , of course , update you with any breaking news overnight .
we 'll back here tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
in the meantime , take a scroll down the timeline to catch-up with all the stories that have been hitting the headlines across the county today .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: woman required operation following 'nasty ' dog attack
text: a woman was left needing surgery after being repeatedly bitten by a dog as she tried to stop it attacking her scottish terrier in great yarmouth .

police are appealing for witnesses to the attack in which the victim sustained bites to her hands and arms after a mastiff/staffordshire terrier-cross dog grabbed her pet by the throat and dragged it away , cutting its neck .
the attack happened on monday at about 16:00 on a playing field off mill road in cobholm , with the victim making several attempts to pull apart the dogs .
investigating officer pc mark carrier said : `` this is quite a nasty attack which has left the victim needing surgery to her hand .
`` the dog is described as having a dark and white coloured coat with distinctive blue eyes and often walked in the park area in cobholm adjacent to breydon bridge .
`` we would be keen to speak with anyone who may have witnessed the incident or has information concerning the owner of the dog . ''
the woman owner has been described as as white and is believed to be eastern european , about 5ft 6in ( 1.67m ) tall , of slim build , and in her late 20s or early 30s .

documents.title: owner of fire-hit bus 'had been fundraising ' for charity vehicle
text: i 've been speaking to the owner of a double-decker bus that went up in flames this afternoon by the side of the a11 .

eunice jokrasset , who is originally from the ivory coast , and friends had collected the vehicle from a garage in watford and were driving it back to her home in smallburgh , north norfolk , when the fire broke out .
she and other villagers had been fundraising for the bus and collecting books and other school equipment since february .
they were planning to fill the bus and hold an opening ceremony in the village later this month , ms jokrasset , who runs the crown inn , said .
the bus was going to be shipped to the ivory coast in september .
`` i can not explain how i 'm feeling .
it 's dreadful , '' ms jokrasset said .
she and friends were in the process of registering as an official charity in order to make the journey easier with the authorities , she added .
the fire service said the blaze , at worsted lodge south of cambridge , started in the engine compartment .

documents.title: africa library bus destroyed in fire
text: africa library bus destroyed in fire

documents.title: rapist being sought by 30-strong police team
text: thirty police officers are trying to track down a rapist who attacked a woman on the outskirts of norwich .
the attack happened on yarmouth road , near the junction with thunder lane , ( in thorpe st andrew on saturday shortly before 10pm .
she was dragged to the ground , shortly after stopping at river green while walking home from the city .
the victim has said the attacker was over 30 years old , white and had a deep voice , with a possible eastern european accent .
det insp neil stewart ( who is leading the investigation , said : `` i am particularly keen on to tapping into people who may have been driving along yarmouth road - it is a busy road .
`` have they got dashcams , have they got footage on their phones which may have up this incident , victim or the offender . ''

documents.title: southampton 's reed makes norwich move
text: southampton 's reed makes norwich move

documents.title: norfolk mp sir henry bellingham raises electoral fraud in commons
text: ministers have pledged to investigate potential electoral fraud following allegations students boasted on social media about voting twice in the general election .

tory mp sir henry bellingham ( north west norfolk ) raised concern over claims of illegal double voting among university students who cast their ballot at their term-time address and then again by post in their home constituency .
cabinet office minister chris skidmore described the practice as an `` abuse of our democracy '' and vowed to take up the issue with the electoral commission .
there were also calls for voters to carry id cards rather than simply providing their name and address at the polls , during a debate in cabinet office questions in the commons .
sir henry said : `` are you aware there is now clear evidence many students boasted on social media about voting twice - once at university and once by post at home ?
`` surely this is straightforward electoral fraud ? ''

documents.title: norwich sign saints midfielder on loan
text: norwich city have announced the signing of southampton 's harrison reed on a season long loan .
the 22-year-old has made 17 premier league appearances to date for the south coast side , having made his debut in 2013 .
that makes it five new faces that have joined the canaries so far this summer .
reed joins marley watkins , angus gunn , christoph zimmerman and mario vrancic at carrow road .
however , both midfielders graham dorrans and jonny howson are expected to leave norwich prior to the start of the new season .
city have signed midfielder @ twitterid on a season-long loan from southampton # ncfc

documents.title: lunchtime weather : hot with a cooling breeze developing
text: it 's pretty hot out there and expected to get even warmer .
the temperature could get as high as 22c ( 72f ) .
there is a small chance of the odd shower punctuating the good weather , while a cool southeasterly breeze is expected to develop keeping eastern coastal areas cooler .

documents.title: cat found dead in washed-up basket 'drowned ' in 'awful way '
text: the rspca is renewing an appeal for information after the body of a cat was found in a basket washed-up on a beach at caister-on-sea .
the basked was found on wednesday , 13 , june .
a preliminary post-mortem has found the cat drowned .
it was described as a young female adult , black and white in colour , and was wearing a black collar with diamante studs .
the wicker basket ( above ) was lined with red gingham check material .
rspca deputy chief inspector ben kirby , investigating , said officers had originally thought the cat may have been `` buried at sea , '' but , he said `` it is likely this cat was drowned '' .
`` this is just an awful way to treat an animal and i hate to think of how this poor cat would have suffered , '' he said .

documents.title: teacher banned for sending inappropriate emails
text: a teacher who gave a pupil presents and sent her inappropriate emails has been banned from teaching indefinitely .

as first reported in the eastern daily press , robin malton , who taught at norwich high school for girls from 2000 to 2016 , was found to have `` failed to maintain professional boundaries '' with a female pupil at the school '' .
the 59-year-old was also found to have taken a photograph of the girl without her permission and held meetings which went beyond the teacher pupil relationship '' .
the panel heard he had admitted he `` done wrong '' and was `` sorry '' .
they also found no evidence of sexual misconduct .
the full hearing document can be seen here .

documents.title: weather watchers ; your in the sun
text: it 's set to be another hot day across norfolk , with temperatures potentially peaking at 25c ( 77f ) .
ideal camera weather some might say and these images from our faithful weather watchers might just prove them right .

documents.title: energy group 's operations base could bring in 150 jobs
text: the developer of two of the world 's largest offshire wind farms off the norfolk coast is hoping to bring its operations base to the county , creating up to 150 jobs .
vattenfall is in talks with peel ports to invest in the port at great yarmouth .
the swedish energy group is keen to locate its operations base for norfolk vanguard and norfolk boreas at the port .
vattenfall and port owner peel ports recently signed a memorandum of understanding to continue negotiations on an exclusive basis .
ruari lean , vattenfall 's project manager for norfolk vanguard , said : it 's clear to me offshore wind promises real economic benefit to norfolk .
`` if we get permission to build both norfolk vanguard and norfolk boreas , our investment can only do good for the region . ''
and richard goffin , port director , peel ports great yarmouth said vattenfall 's ambitions `` dovetail perfectly with our own vision for commercial ventures at the port '' .

documents.title: police patrols increased after woman raped in thorpe st andrew
text: extra police patrols have been put on after a woman was raped in thorpe st andrew on the edge of norwich .
the incident happened on saturday night in the yarmouth road area near river green .
the woman in her 30s was walking home at 20:00 when she was grabbed by the man who pushed her to the ground and raped her .

documents.title: hero lorry driver gets life saving gong
text: a lorry driver from norfolk has been hailed a hero for preventing a multiple pile-up .
russell dagless , from saxthorpe , has been given britain 's highest bravery honour for his actions on the a47 .
mr dagless had been driving along the a47 at north tuddenham in his articulated lorry in january when he saw a van in front swerve into the central reservation .
the driver was slumped over the steering wheel and the van was bouncing off the barrier .
mr dagless quickly drew his long vehicle right up alongside the van to stop it .
the royal humane society said it was like a scene from an all-action movie and that mr daglass 's actions saved the life of the driver .

documents.title: weather : warm day ahead
text: it 's set to be a hot , dry and sunny day with highs of 25c ( 77f ) expected .
want to know more ?
here 's my full weather report
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to today 's norfolk live
text: hello and welcome to our live page for norfolk .
we 'll be covering news , sport , travel and weather across the county until 18:00 .
first up , a full weather report .

documents.title: murder trial drug dealer jailed
text: murder trial drug dealer jailed

documents.title: that 's all from local live this tuesday
text: that 's it from the local live team today - but , of course , we will update this feed with any breaking news overnight .
take a scroll down the timeline to see the stories that have been hitting the headlines across the county today .
we will be back at our keyboards from 08:00 tomorrow - join us then .
have a good evening .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: haulier crushed by hay bales 'died accidentally '
text: a coroner has recorded a verdict of accidental death after a 54-year-old haulier was crushed under bales of hay he was loading .
peter fisher , who was a contractor for c & m haulage of cranworth near dereham , was re-loading bales at the company 's premises for a delivery to snetterton on 11 february .
he was found under the bales later that morning .
norwich coroners ' court heard his chest and body had been crushed .
the inquest heard mr fisher , of freethorpe , had worked in farming all his life and he was described as `` more than competent '' and `` professional in his job at all times '' .
the coroner , johanna thompson , offered his family `` her sincere condolences '' .

documents.title: drug dealer jailed following murder case
text: a drug dealer from london , who was arrested during a murder inquiry in norwich , has been jailed for three-and-a-half years at the city 's crown court .
veron antonio , 24 , of green lane , morden , was found guilty of supplying class a drugs at a trial in may .
he was found not guilty of assisting hassiem baqir , who was convicted of murdering steve stannard , 37 , in his norwich flat last year (
baqir was jailed for at least 20 years at an earlier hearing .

documents.title: man shot with air rifle
text: a man in great yarmouth is recovering after being shot with what police believe was an air rifle .
he was left with a puncture wound to his stomach .
it happened on duncan road shortly after 19:00 on saturday .
police want witnesses to contact them .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: inquest into farm worker death
text: an inquest into the death of a farm worker has begun at norfolk coroners court .
peter fisher , who was 54 , was found dead under straw bales at a farm near dereham in february .
the jury has heard that peter fisher knew his job inside and out .
on 11 february peter fisher was at c & m haulage at high house farm in cranworth , in the early hours of saturday morning .
he was planning to take a straw delivery to snetterton power station , which he did regularly .
the jury heard from jonathan cole who employed peter and tried to save him .
mr cole said peter was purple in the face when he got to him and by the time he managed to get the bales off him , an ambulance had arrived .
the inquest continues .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: new fgm survey reveals cases in norfolk
text: fifteen cases of female genital mutilation ( fgm ) have been identified in norfolk .
across the eastern region , 90 cases were identified by the nhs and nationally the study reveals nearly 5,500 new cases in the past year .

fgm is the removal of external female genitalia , including the clitoris , and was made illegal in the uk in 1985 with the law strengthened in 2003 to prevent girls travelling from the uk to undergo operations abroad .
most of the cases are to be found among people of african origin .
the condition was identified by midwives and medical staff .
in all bar 57 cases , the women and children had their operations abroad .
eastern region in this instance is norfolk , suffolk , cambridgeshire and essex .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: howson set to leave norwich ?
text: the press association 's nick mashiter is reporting that one of norwich city 's prize assets could be close to leaving .
midfielder jonny howson is said to be ready for a move to middlesbrough for a fee of about £ 5m .
the 29-year-old has been with the canaries for the five years and was named player of the season in 2016 .
barring any late hitches middlesbrough have won the race for norwich 's jonny howson .
# mfc # ncfc

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: porter delivers baby by lifts
text: a quick-thinking porter has been praised for helping to deliver a baby girl outside the lifts at the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn .

new parents henry and mellissa pettitt , aged 31 and 27 respectively , were making their way up to the hospital 's maternity suite when baby sophie decided that she could not wait to make her arrival .

luckily , porter stephen eadie had just come out of the lift and was able to support the couple by raising the alarm along with cradling sophie 's head in the minutes before community midwife cat tipling arrived .
staff from a & e and paramedics had also dashed to the scene to help and baby sophie was born behind a screen at 22:53 on sunday , 18 june , weighing 7lb 14oz .
a grateful mrs pettitt said : `` if you had told me that i would give birth in a hospital corridor , i would not have believed you .

`` i thought labour would take ages , but when we arrived at the hospital and reached the end of the corridor , i felt a contraction pushing down and i tried my hardest not to push , but her head just kept coming out . ''
at that point , stephen came out of the lift and initially offered to wheel them up to maternity , but on realising that there was n't time he put out a call for help over the radio .
stephen , who has been a porter for four years , said : `` i was cradling the baby 's head for a short while before assistance arrived .
`` i was just there in the right place at the right time .
it 's just part of my job . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: self-esteem workshops held for norwich school children
text: you may have seen the disturbing headline on the bbc website yesterday about very young girls wanting cosmetic surgery because they felt their bodies did n't conform to the norm .

an event held yesterday saw year 9 pupils from jane austen college , hobart high school , framingham earl high school and norwich school taking part in workshops on mental health with members of the national self-esteem team ( set ) .
to included `` performing under pressure '' , `` body image and self-esteem '' and `` healthy ways to deal with difficult feelings '' .
grace barrett of set says : `` even as adults we 're aware that social media can leave you feeling a little iffy about your life , because you see everybody 's perfectly-filtered world .
`` it 's the same for teens , but i ca n't ignore the fact i consistently have children as young as 13 and 14 telling me that they 're stressed and anxious about whether they 'll get into uni . ''
event organiser nicola hill of the norwich school says `` we were lucky enough to have natasha devon [ from the set team ] come and speak with our year 10 and 11 pupils earlier this year .
`` her message was so well received . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: 'too short ' haircut boy returns to school
text: a boy who was thrown out of the classroom because of his haircut has returned to school
damon steel , 15 , attends marshland high school in west walton near king 's lynn .
teachers put him in isolation and made him study by himself because they said his new haircut was too short .
damon , an army cadet , had his hair cut on 19 june .
but the next day he was called in by staff and told the style was not suitable , his mother elizabeth steel said .
she pulled him out of school completely in protest , but says he 's going back to classes this morning .

`` the board of governors has decided the policy is not clear on the haircut so they 're going to allow damon back into school but they are going to review the policy over the summer holidays and i 'm [ hoping ] that it will be changing . ''
the school , which is part of the west norfolk academies trust group rather than county council-run , has said it did n't want to comment on the matter .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lifeguards to patrol norfolk beaches
text: lifeguards will be on duty on 12 norfolk beaches this summer starting this weekend .
the rnli says its lifeguards have already had to carry out several rescues this summer .
the latest was this weekend at trimingham where a woman had to cling to a groyne after gettting pulled out to sea .
the rnli is also starting a new campaign called float to live to encourage people in trouble to keep calm and float .
jim page from cromer lifeboat also offers to go into schools to make children more aware of the dangers , but he says there 's been a very poor uptake .
`` it 's absolutely free , but of the 19 applications i sent out to different schools i got only one reply , '' he said .
`` it 's heart-breaking when you do this , but this is the attitude and we 've got to force ourselves into these places to talk to children . ''
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : cloudy with sunny spells
text: there 's a lot of cloud about in the bbc look east region this morning especially the further north you are , and where it it thickest we may get a light shower .
as we get into the afternoon the cloud will thin and break bringing spells of sunshine .
temperatures reaching 23c ( 73f ) , although it will be cooler on the coast .
weather has more local forecasts .

we 're keyboard-ready to bring you all the county 's latest news , travel , sport and weather as it happens .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team on monday so goodbye and have a good evening .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow , bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .
today we 've covered a £ 19m scheme to `` sandscape '' beaches around bacton gas terminal .
we 've also reported on the county council liquidating its wholly-owned renewable energy company .
scroll down to see these stories and a lot more besides .
if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about overnight , you can contact us via the `` getting involved '' button at the top of the page .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather
text: the last of any showers should quickly clear to leave a mainly dry night across the bbc east region with variable amounts of cloud and light winds .
most places staying in double figures overnight with temperatures no lower than 11c ( 52f ) .
tuesday will be largely fine and dry , although cloud is likely to thicken from the south during the day .
any showers will be very isolated and mainly in the north of the region accompanied by light winds .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f )
more details for where you are from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: weather : sunshine and dark skies
text: our bbc weather watchers caught the contrast in the weather this afternoon from bright sunshine to dark foreboding clouds and showers as our show .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: county liquidates its own renewable energy company
text: a company set up by norfolk county council to make money from renewable energy is to be liquidated with debts of about £ 400,000 .
norfolk energy futures ltd was set up in september 2011 to generate income for the council and improve its carbon footprint through renewable energy projects .
after six years the company 's still operating at a loss , although it was in debt when originally set up .
a report to the county 's policy and resources committee blames poor choice of equipment for two wind turbine projects and operations that were too small scale for solar power installations .
today councillors voted to liquidate the limited company and bring its operations back in house with the debts written off by the county council .
the community and environmental services department will now look at how energy savings can be made in the property the council owns and on its farms , the report said .
the council said in a statement : `` the work of norfolk energy futures will be moved from one norfolk county council department to another .
`` this will enable a more joined-up approach to securing and delivering renewable energy projects , particularly in relation to the county council 's property estate . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: liam neeson backs same-sex marriage in ni
text: liam neeson backs same-sex marriage in ni

documents.title: nature reserve reclaimed from saltmarsh over several centuries
text: the largely man-made landscape reclaimed from saltmarsh between the 17th and 19th centuries in north norfolk , and now a nature reserve , is to be taken over by an estate owned and run by a long-established aristocratic family .
the holkham estate and nearby nature reserve were built up over the centuries by the coke family whose head carried the title earl of leicester .
natural england has granted the estate approved body status enabling it to take over the running of the nature reserve on its own .
a small team led by the conservation manager is responsible for the daily management of the reserve .

holkham estate has long been recognised as a leading farming business and the management of the reserve demonstrates how modern farming and high standards of nature conservation can thrive together , natural england said .
the earl of leicester added : `` i am very proud the holkham estate has been awarded this special status .

`` we have been running the reserve now for over four years under the watchful eye of natural england , who have been really helpful and supportive , and of course we managed it for over 300 years . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: norwich city captain signs new deal
text: russell martin has signed a new contract at norwich city , keeping him at carrow road until 2019 .
that will make it 10 years since the skipper joined from peterborough united .
there 's an option for an extra year included .
martin has been praised by new boss daniel farke , with the german describing him as an `` idol '' .
russell martin signs new deal with the canaries .

documents.title: earl of leicester 's estate team to manage nature reserve
text: a private estate , owned by the earl of leicester , is to take over management of a nature reserve which covers the coastline from blakeney to burnham norton .
rare and precious habitats including salt marsh , sand dunes , pine woodland , beach and grazing marsh are contained within the reserve previously managed by natural england .
the holkham estate , has won approved body status under section 35 of the wildlife and countryside act , enabling its wardens to look after the reserve .
`` holkham is one of a select few privately-owned estates in england to hold this status , '' a natural england spokesperson said .
`` national nature reserves ( nnrs ) include some of the best examples of england 's wildlife and geology .
`` there are 224 of these reserves in england covering 94,000 hectares with natural england managing 143 on its own , or jointly with others .
`` the remainder are managed by approved bodies . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: police seek car as cash stolen in burglary
text: money was stolen from a house in emneth , near wisbech , during a burglary yesterday .
intruders were in the house for about 30 minutes before they were disturbed by the homeowners on church road , shortly after midday .
they fled in a silver audi tt .
police are asking for any other witnesses to come forward .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: norwich captain martin extends contract
text: norwich captain martin extends contract

documents.title: rising sea levels and coastal erosion threat to gas terminal
text: coastal erosion and rising sea levels are posing a threat to bacton gas terminal and nearby village communities prompting proposals for the new defences , which we mentioned earlier .

the cabinet at north norfolk district council is today looking at proposals costing up to £ 19m for `` sandscaping '' the beaches and coastal areas using techniques successfully used in the netherlands .
this represents the best chance of sustaining the defences for the villages while ensuring the nationally critical gas infrastructure at bacton gas terminal is protected , the council said .

the council has invested £ 1.3m in the maintenance of sea wall and revetments at bacton and walcott over the past 10 years , but continued maintenance of the groynes is limited because of falling beach levels .
the sand is expected to extend the life of the existing defences for bacton and walcott , while enhancing the beaches and benefiting tourism , the council added .
the cabinet report is asking for approval for the scheme which would be carried out with the bacton terminal operators .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: education bosses blamed for delays in finding school place for teen
text: education bosses in norfolk are being blamed for delays in finding suitable schooling for a teenager with asperger syndrome who had been temporarily excluded .
james russell , 13 , was excluded from acle academy following an incident at the school which his parents blame on a change to his special educational needs provision .
he was excluded for one day , but has not been back to the academy for a year and is being taught at home by completing e-learning lessons .
he knows that it is not possible to return , because the school is unable to provide for his special needs .
in a statement , helen watts , the head teacher at acle academy , said : `` the russell family have been well supported by the school , but have been let down by the local authority system .
`` we have been disappointed with the delay in this process and lack of responses from some aspects of norfolk county council services .
`` we are determined to help find a successful solution to ensure james can thrive and fulfil his academic potential . ''
meanwhile , the county council said : `` we are unable to comment in detail on individual cases .
but we can confirm that this pupil has not been permanently excluded .
`` this is a fixed term exclusion and as such it is the responsibility of the school to provide education at this point .
`` this would only become a local authority issue if it reached permanent exclusion .
`` however , the council has been asked to provide a specialist placement for this pupil and this is in progress . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: naismith : i need to repay the canaries
text: here is the back sports page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: in the news : city salon owner in remarkable fightback
text: here is the front page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: town 's ww2 bomb census map made available to all
text: details of the sites where world war two bombs hit king 's lynn , set out on a map from the 1940s , have been made available for interested school groups , historians and residents .
the town was n't heavily targeted during the war , but the impact of the bombs that did hit homes and factories were recorded by the government .
the town 's borough archives now has made that map available for anyone to see .
in september 1940 , the government wanted to collate information relating to bomb damage sustained during raids .
this `` bomb census '' originally only covered the major cities of london , birmingham and liverpool , but by 1941 it was required across the whole of the uk .
trainee archivist luke shackell explained : `` this bomb map was transferred to us in 2002 along with a number of other maps .
`` i am currently cataloguing the backlog of documents and felt that this one was of particular interest . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: in the news : hewett steps up his bid for glory
text: here is the back sports page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: excluded teeenage boy loses year of education
text: a 13-year-old boy from norfolk with asperger syndrome is still waiting to get back into education almost a year after being excluded for one day following an incident at acle academy .
james russell from rollesby was n't permanently excluded , but has discovered he is n't eligible for the alternative schools across the county .
his parents , christine and robert russell , claim that because of cuts the school is unable to provide his special educational needs and said he 'd been badly let down by the system overall .
christine said if she had kept her son out of school for a year she would probably be in prison by now .
james says he 's been cut off from his friends and has no happiness in his life .
norfolk county council said it was in the process of providing a specialist placement for james .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: in the news : long-awaited boost for region 's fishing fleet
text: here is the front page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: county faced with further budget cuts of £ 125m
text: proposals are being made to cut a further £ 125m from county council budgets , possibly by scrapping some services .
political correspondent andrew sinclair said norfolk county council had already made £ 334m of savings over the past six years .
`` now it says further cuts to the budget are needed to ensure that it continues to help those most in need and continues to encourage economic growth in the county , '' he said .
`` community services , children 's services and adult social care are likely to have to make the biggest savings .
`` there are no specific plans yet , although there have been suggestions that some libraries and day care centres may have to close . ''
council leader cliff jordan said he would tell the local government secretary `` local councils have done enough to make savings .
government should look in its own cupboard '' .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: plan to 'sandscape ' shoreline near gas terminal to cost £ 19m
text: plans to bolster sea defences around the bacton gas terminal and nearby villages , described as a `` great opportunity '' to give a new look to the shoreline at a cost of up to £ 19m , are to be discussed today .
north norfolk district council 's cabinet is to assess a scheme to `` sandscape '' beaches in front of the terminal and down the coast .
`` this is the next step in helping to make this scheme a reality .
it 's a necessary proposal and a great opportunity to enhance protection for the villages , '' john lee , cabinet member for coastal management said .

`` this is the best option on the table for bacton and walcott and i 'm proud that north norfolk district council is looking to work in partnership with the bacton terminal operators to potentially deliver this project , which would be the first at this scale in the uk .
`` it 's an exciting project which shows the benefit of the public and private sectors working together . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: lake is uk champion
text: city of norwich athlete iona lake is celebrating becoming uk champion .
lake won the 3,000m steeplechase to clinch the national title at the world championships team trials in birmingham yesterday .
the 24-year-old did n't run a quick enough time to qualify for the iaaf world championships which take place in london next month , but it was her first major seniors title .
winning here today is huge , it 's almost a personal best time .
coming back from injury i was n't expecting that , so i 'm really happy . ''
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy with showers in the afternoon
text: a cloudy start to the day for many places with rain expected during the afternoon .
showers will give way to warm evening sunshine .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f )
more details from bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live coverage for norfolk
text: good morning and and welcome to a new week of norfolk live .
between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .

plans to bolster sea defences at bacton gas terminal and nearby villages discussed today by north norfolk district council 's cabinet are described as a `` once in a lifetime '' opportunity - we 'll bring you more later .
there 's more news in the pipeline in what could be a bright day despite these dramatic skies from earlier this morning by a bbc weather watcher .
that brings us to the weather which will be up next .
but if there 's anything you wish to share with us you can contact us via the `` get involved '' button at the top of the page .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: how far could you go in one of these ? # getinspired
text: rob groves , 61 , is getting ready to handcycle 2,500 miles around the coast of england and wales , starting off in brighton this sunday , 2 july and finishing in london on friday , 28 july .
read all about rob 's former life as a bodybuilder , his journey into handcycling , his aims for the ride and how you can keep up with it here .
